intro: Jurinea tapetodes, commonly known as the desert sandflower, is a flowering plant native to arid and semi-arid regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the family Amaranthaceae and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and succulent leaves adapted to conserve water. The plant thrives in sandy or gravelly soils and is often found in dry steppes and desert margins. Its growth is slow, and it can survive extreme temperature fluctuations. Jurinea tapetodes plays a role in stabilizing soil and providing habitat for small desert organisms.
